intro: Tetrastigma stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leafining vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing several seeds. Tetrastigma stenophyllum is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives as a semi-evergreen vine.
